comment: She is unfriendly to non-traditional students

Most of the content of the labs was not taught in the lecture until the following week, so we would be in lab unsure of most things. When I asked her for help, she expected me to know the information and left me feeling stupid asking for help. Grades really tough on lab reports and takes off most credit for a simple small errors. Didn't learn much.

Dr. Weldy is amazing. I wish I had her for lecture too but lab was still fine. All you have to do is your lab reports (which are worksheets from a book) each week. She is great at explaining and will gratefully help you out with anything. The only thing I recommend is to pay attention in lecture and double check all your work to get good grades!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Weldy is very passionate about Chemistry and just going to class will help you out on the 4 tests that are only 20-30 multiple choice questions. The lowest grade is dropped. She gives Mastering Chemistry homework and bonus points and counts those as another test grade. Took her over summer so the class was a little rushed but I still did well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Wendy is a great professor! Be sure to get as many points in Learning Catalytics and Mastering Chemistry as you can, it pays off in the end. Grade consists of homework, 4 test (lowest grade dropped), and final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Nina Wendy is a wonderful professor! She gives great lectures and knows exactly what she's talking about. She's really got a passion for chem.  Attendance is required for LC points. Her test are fairly easy, as long as you show up, take notes and pay attention. There are four test (all multiple choice) and the final plu she drops the lowest grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Weldy was a good experience. While i'm not really a fan of Chemistry, Professor Weldy managed to make it somewhat interesting through sheer enthusiasm and knowledge of the subject matter. She moves pretty quick, but she doesn't mind reiterating things in a different way to make sure everybody understands. Great Chemistry professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: I am not good at Chemistry. However, when I took Dr. Weldy, she immediately made it easier for me to understand. She is always available after class & during office hours. She is also one of the sweetest people you could ever meet. She makes taking Chemistry fun!

Dr. Weldy is great! She provides note outlines before class and her lectures are very straightforward. She is very strict and won't allow students to take missed exams even if there is an viable reason, so bear that in mind. However, she is one of the best OCHEM professors here.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: She makes an incredibly hard class much easier. She isn't clueless about her stuff and remains perky every day. Probably the best chem teacher you could take and one of the best at KSU. Class consists of online hw and 4 tests. The tests will be hard but don't be discouraged to go to her for help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Probably one of the best Chem professors at Kennesaw. Not only does she know her material, she won't make you feel bad for not knowing it the way she does. Instead, she'll work with you to make sure you get to the point you need to be. It's a hard class, but she makes it feel so much more manageable.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: I loved Dr. Weldy. I took her for lab and she was very helpful. She was always willing to answer questions no matter how stupid they may be. She does a great job of explaining. She even helped me grasp some things better for lecture. Definitely take her! Grades come from 9 labs, 4 pop quizzes and a final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Weldy is awesome! She takes her time to explain in class and also has office hours. She provides notes online and makes you print them out so that you can follow note taking in class, which in my opinion is way easier. Her exams are also really easy as long as you study the notes given in class, and she is very generous with extra credits!

I ended up taking Dr. Weldy for 3362 and still stick to what I said when I took her for 3361. She is by far one of the best professors at KSU! Same layout as 3361: 3 exams + final, quizzes (2 drop), hw, etc. Again, don't be afraid to ask a question if you don't understand something! I wish I could take her for every class! favorite class by far!

BY FAR, the best professors I have had at KSU. The content of Organic Chem 2 can be hard to understand, but the way she explains it makes it fun & easy for you to get. She is a very thorough teacher and is more than willing to help you. They're 3 test & 1 final, quizzes, HW, and extra credit. I definitely recommend taking her! I enjoyed her class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Weldy shows great enthusiasm while lecturing, you can tell she really loves her field,  and this enthusiasm helps you get into the material as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Amazing, passionate and nerdy about chemistry. Three tests, one final. Tests are half multiple choice and free response (synthesis, mechanisms, nomenclature). Provides extra credit for participation, and curves tests based on class performance in exchange for filling out lecture notes. Also offers study sessions for tests and always willing to help

Very sweet teacher. Has lots of enthusiasm and energy. Gave a lot of extra credit oppurtunities by doing test corrections. Helps you if you need it. One thing that upset me a little was that I ended with a 79.3 in the class and after speaking to her and explaining how hard I worked, she would not round it up to an 80. Besides that, good teacher

By far one of the best professors at KSU! 3 exams and a final, HW, Quiz's (she drops 2), and multiple extra credit opportunities! She is truly so passionate about Chemistry that it almost makes you as excited as she is. BTW she DOES explain problems in class! If you're confused, DON'T be afraid to ask a question. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF OFFICE HOURS!

The way she teaches is not for me. She gives you note pages and its your job to print them out to copy the notes that she rewrites with you in class. If you are a visual learner this class is for you but I am not so her just drawing out reactions did not help me at all especially since she barely explained the problems as she did them.

Dr. Weldy is one of the better teachers at Kennesaw State.  Great positive mental attitude and not dead inside like most of the zombies walking around.  The class is setup with buffers grade wise and plenty of extra credit.  Don't have your phone out during class and avoid leaving early.  If you learn the material, the grades will follow.

Dr. Weldy is a fantastic professor. She offers help when needed. The only critique I would have of her is that she does tend to rush but that is ONLY because of how much material there is to cover in little time. So I don't blame her for rushing. She is smart but I feel like she doesn't know everything, then again I wouldnt expect her to. TAKE HER!

Dr. Weldy is a great professor, she is passionate about teaching chemistry and truly cares for her students and eager to help. There are also extra credit opportunities if you go up to the board to answer practice examples.

Truly she loves teaching organic chemistry and it really shows. She is very thorough in lecture, and makes sure that you understand the material expected. Dr Weldy wants to make sure that you do your very best and she makes herself  available outside of lecture if you need help. That being said, O Chem is not easy and requires a lot of work.

I have always struggled with chemistry, although I am a biology major. I enjoyed her as a person, but chemistry is hard to teach. Her lectures are always long and boring for the most part. She's super sweet and loves to help out in any way she can. Only a few tests in her class and a ton of online homework. I have heard of better professors.

Very fair teacher. Gives opportunities to improve your grade throughout the course.  I suggest reading the book before lecture. Tries her best to keep lectures entertaining. Go to class, read the chapters, and do the homework and you should come out with at least a C higher. I would definitely take again because she truly cares for her students.
She is a very good professor. She will help you during lab. She does grade lab a little harshly. Very nice and respectful teacher, but she follows the rules.

I had her for lab. My partners and I stayed after every single lab and she would help us through the worksheet. She explained what was going on in lecture really well and showed different ways of doing things which was usually helpful. She tries to get to know her students and appears to really want to help us.
Professor Weldy was a good teacher for lab. She was very clear about her grading and would answer any questions you had. I would recommend her for lab!

I am taking Dr. Weldy for lab this semester. She has been great! She makes sure that everyone in the class understands what is going on during the lab. She thoroughly answers everyone's questions.  She even invited us to come to her review sessions meant for her lecture class. She is one of my favorite professors this semester. Take her!

Dr. Weldy is energetic and makes class interesting. She gives pop quizzes, but if you show up to that class you get at least an 80 for taking the quiz. She also gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. The homework can be a bit troublesome at times but is super helpful. As long as you come to class and take good notes you'll be fine.

I love Dr. Weldy!!! She makes lab really fun and is honestly the only reason I kept taking Chem this semester. She is always open to help you in her office hours if your don't understand post lab questions. She is seriously so so nice as well! I am so mad I don't have her for the Chem lecture cause she's so so great!!!

I.  Freaking.  Love.  Dr. Weldy.  Not only does she present the information in a very understandable way, she seems to really enjoy her job and is incredibly sweet.  She grades very fairly, and curves are not at all uncommon.  If you do the homework and take notes in class you'll pass with a good grade.  She gives extra credit where she sees need.

If I didn't have her as my lab professor, I would never have passed my lecture class. She's very helpful and will go through every step with you. The labs are always fun, and it's really cool how excited she is about our experiments. I plan on taking her again when I have to take organic chemistry. I definitely recommend.
She is very helpful and has after class sessions for tests. She cares that you understand the content. There are a lot of extra credit opportunities if you are willing to do the work.
She was a super helpful teacher. Whenever I have questions she is there to answer them. I really do not like Chemistry, but she made Chem Lab bearable.
